ai-patthana14.9:0.2_0: The Order of the Dhamma ladies that are difficult for the living, etc.,
ai-patthana14.9:1.1_1: One doesn’t give rise to repulsion; he doesn’t give rise to the cause of misery.
ai-patthana14.9:1.1_2: merely by hating on a repulsion, without impingement, repulsion, and with no cause or condition.
ai-patthana14.9:2.1_0: Not repulsion arises dependent on thought, repulsion gives rise to causes.
ai-patthana14.9:2.1_1: Not repulsion arises dependent on thought, the teaching doesn’t give rise to repulsion.
ai-patthana14.9:2.1_2: Formlessness do not arise because of not impingement, nor asking resentment, because of a cause or condition.
ai-patthana14.9:3.1_0: Not repulsion arises dependent on the repulsion. The teaching doesn’t give rise to the cause.
ai-patthana14.9:3.1_1: Not repulsion arises dependent on the repulsion, not independent of others.
ai-patthana14.9:3.1_2: Formlessness and impingement don’t arise because of not resentment, nor because of grasping the cause or condition.
ai-patthana14.9:3.1_3: This is the section in brief.
ai-patthana14.9:4.1_0: ‘... for the sake of a single object, or six objects, the six classes of offenses, but all the world’s material delights.’ ...
